content: chibi witch hat ✧ ∞ overview ∞ ✧ ༺ ༻ by meredith buck the hat is made in the round from the top down starting with a magic_ring ✧ ∞ intro ∞ ✧ increases are worked continuously until ༺ ༻ the working edge reaches your desired a witch hat on the shorter side it s made size see section size guide for notes with a double-weight raffia yarn and a on sizing smaller hook resulting in a dense yet lightweight texture that stands up at this point we transition to the brim by straight crocheting through the front loop only this helps achieve a sharp angle and if you re not used to crocheting densely proper look of the brim from here the let alone with raffia this could prove a bit brim is worked outward as far as you of a workout for you i suggest brewing a like potion aka herbal tea before you start so you can take breaks and stay there are 2 important finishing steps hydrated along the way first a crab stitch is worked while carrying craft wire along which helps the brim to stay flat second a cord is threaded through the stitches at the brim transition this helps keep the brim angle looking crisp how to calculate your target count ✧ ༺ ∞ materials ∞ ༻ ✧ - the first step is to take a measurement of the head your hat is intended for yarn & hook - then multiply this measurement by for the same look as my hat you ll want the stitches per inch in your swatch a cone of manila hemp double from this number is your target stitch marchenart yarns you can also use a count different raffia yarn but try hitting gauge - in the pattern find the round with the with 2 yarns held together if need be so total stitch count that s closest to you get a dense texture that stands up your target stitch count mark this as properly you could also use a different your final increase round fiber altogether just make sure your - once you have completed the swatch is quite stiff not floppy at all increase round before your final unless you want your witch hat to be increase round you will crochet two slouchy rounds straight next comes the final increase round you will also work two meterage rounds straight after your final appx 300-400 m for single yarn or increase round double meterage for double yarn for example my target circumference is recommended needle size 22 and my stitch-per-inch is 4 if i us 10/j 6 mm multiply 22 x 4 i get a target count of 88 stitches the round with the nearest gauge count would be round 28 with 90 total 4 x 4 or 10 x 10 cm swatch stitches so i will work round 26 then 14 stitches x 17 row in single_crochet crochet 2 rounds straight then work my final increase
